properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (string: <required>) - A unique name for the policy.

properties.name: rules_hcl
properties.description: (string: <required>) - The contents of the policy to register, as HCL or JSON.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (string: "") - A description of the policy.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type (string: <required>) - The type of token this is. Use client for tokens that will have policies associated with them. Use management for tokens that can perform any action.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name (string: "") - A human-friendly name for this token.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies (set: []) - A set of policy names to associate with this token. Must be set on client-type tokens, must not be set on management-type tokens. Policies do not need to exist before being used here.

properties.name: global
properties.description: • global (bool: false) - Whether the token should be replicated to all regions, or if it will only be used in the region it was created in.
In addition to the above arguments, the following attributes are exported and can be referenced:

properties.name: accessor_id
properties.description: • accessor_id (string) - A non-sensitive identifier for this token that can be logged and shared safely without granting any access to the cluster.

properties.name: secret_id
properties.description: • secret_id (string) - The token value itself, which is presented for access to the cluster.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: jobspec
properties.description: • jobspec (string: <required>) - The contents of the jobspec to register.

properties.name: deregister_on_destroy
properties.description: • deregister_on_destroy (bool: true) - Determines if the job will be deregistered when this resource is destroyed in Terraform.

properties.name: deregister_on_id_change
properties.description: • deregister_on_id_change (bool: true) - Determines if the job will be deregistered if the ID of the job in the jobspec changes.

properties.name: detach
properties.description: • detach (bool: true) - If true, the provider will return immediately after creating or updating, instead of monitoring.

properties.name: policy_override
properties.description: • policy_override (bool: false) - Determines if the job will override any soft-mandatory Sentinel policies and register even if they fail.

properties.name: json
properties.description: • json (bool: false) - Set this to true if your jobspec is structured with JSON instead of the default HCL.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (string: <required>) - A unique name for the namespace.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (string: "") - A description of the namespace.

properties.name: quota
properties.description: (string: "") - A resource quota to attach to the namespace.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (string: <required>) - A unique name for the quota specification.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (string: "") - A description of the quota specification.

properties.name: limits
properties.description: (block: <required>) - A block of quota limits to enforce. Can be repeated. See below for the structure of this block.

properties.name: limits-blocks
properties.description: » limits blocks
The limits block describes the quota limits to be enforced. It supports the following arguments:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (string: <required>) - The region these limits should apply to.

properties.name: region_limit
properties.description: (block: <required>) - The limits to enforce. This block may only be specified once in the limits block. Its structure is documented below.

properties.name: region_limit-blocks
properties.description: » region_limit blocks
The region_limit block describes the quota limits to be enforced on a region. It supports the following arguments:

properties.name: cpu
properties.description: (int: 0) - The amount of CPU to limit allocations to. A value of zero is treated as unlimited, and a negative value is treated as fully disallowed.

properties.name: memory_mb
properties.description: (int: 0) - The amount of memory (in megabytes) to limit allocations to. A value of zero is treated as unlimited, and a negative value is treated as fully disallowed.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (string: <required>) - A unique name for the policy.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (string: <required>) - The contents of the policy to register.

properties.name: enforcement_level
properties.description: (strings: <required>) - The enforcement level for this policy.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: (strings: <required>) - The scope for this policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (string: "") - A description of the policy.
